definition: to drift with the waves and go with the flow (idiom); to follow the crowd blindly
surname Sui
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
wave/ripple/storm/surge
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
to pursue/to chase/individually/one by one
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Waves to slash one of the ship, Adventures of a funeral procession for the drift.
sentences.chinese: 海浪为劈风斩浪的航船饯行，为随波逐流的轻舟送葬。

sentences.english: He is the kind of person who swims with the tide.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种随波逐流的人。

sentences.english: On the way to the island, he would pull in the oars and just let the boat drift where it wished, for hours at a time.
sentences.chinese: 在去荒岛的途中，他会撤了浆任由小舟随波逐流。

sentences.english: The leading boat fell away when the wind grew too strong.
sentences.chinese: 在风刮得太猛时，领头的船只能随波逐流了。

sentences.english: Fogbound, with no compass, and adrift, I started trying things.
sentences.chinese: 迷失雾中，没有方向，随波逐流，我开始了新的尝试。

sentences.english: So Billy just went along with them.
sentences.chinese: 所以比利也只是随波逐流。

sentences.english: Don't be like a sheep, following the herd.
sentences.chinese: 别像小绵羊那样，随波逐流。

sentences.english: I didn't wear mascara in Just Go WithIt.
sentences.chinese: 在随波逐流里面，我没涂睫毛膏。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, those who follow the crowd usually get lost in it.
sentences.chinese: 很可惜的是，那些随波逐流的人最后往往迷失其中。

sentences.english: A man without aspirations is like an unpowered boat which has to go with the waves.
sentences.chinese: 没有志向的人，就好比没有动力的船，只能随波逐流。

sentences.english: He insisted that his political views, and never follow the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持自己的政治主张，决不随波逐流。

sentences.english: You now have censors and surveillance coercing your conformity and soliciting submission.
sentences.chinese: 你现在有了传感器和监视系统强迫你随波逐流。

sentences.english: The one who follows the crowd will usually go no further than the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 随波逐流的人通常走不出泯然众人之中。

sentences.english: I still was a Taoist priest, a small drift priests.
sentences.chinese: 我依旧是一个道士，一个随波逐流的小道士。

sentences.english: Only dead fish follow the flow.
When he listened to yvonne, he could coast contentedly.
sentences.chinese: 在听伊冯唠叨时，他可以不费心思地随波逐流。

definition: to follow the crowd/going with the tide
to say what everyone says (idiom)/to conform to what one perceives to be the majority view/to follow the herd
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to sail against the current/(fig.) to go against the flow
to follow blindly/to conform slavishly/unthinking obedience
ordinary/mediocre
at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt/flexible/to accept circumstances with good will
lit. navigating a boat against the current (idiom)/fig. in a tough environment (one needs to work hard)
a pool of stagnant water/stagnant or listless condition
(idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
mediocre/indifferent/commonplace
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
to feel contented with
mediocre
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
